programme.title: Moby Doc
Moby Doc
programme.desc: Moby Doc: Directed by Rob Gordon Bralver. With Moby, David Lynch, Julie Mintz, Gary Baseman. A surrealist biographical documentary about trailblazing electronic musician and animal rights activist Moby." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt5452210/","name":"Moby Doc","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNzViMmFlMjItODgxMy00NTg2LWIyZjAtODQwM2VjNmI5MmIxXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyOTM5NzYzNTU@._V1_.jpg","description":"A surrealist biographical documentary about trailblazing electronic musician and animal rights activist Moby.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt5452210/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"WePerished"},"dateCreated":"2021-07-29","inLanguage":"English","name":"Somehow makes trauma feel like vanity","reviewBody":"As a big Moby fan back in the day I was really excited to see it. But what a bizarre documentary. Very contrived interview set up with fake conversations with fake psychiatrists and with people on the phone. Stylistically it jumps around and is very inconsistent. The story leaps around and doesn't link together and huge periods of his life are just left out. There's very odd b-roll choices and over-use of space and rockets. The humour feels awkward and makes the deeper stuff seem like it wasn't to be taken serious.\n\nBut the most disappointing thing was how insincere it comes across. For a story with so much trauma, sadness, suicide etc it comes across more as vanity than vulnerability. I appreciate bold creative choices, but boy did they make the wrong ones here. It just completely undermined the themes of the film. It's a mess that makes Moby less relatable. This is exactly how NOT to make a documentary about this subject matter.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":6}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":715,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":7.3},"genre":["Documentary","Biography","Music"],"datePublished":"2021-05-28","keywords":"musician,fame,animal,vegan,grim reaper","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Moby Doc","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi3750084633","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNjY3NTAxZjUtNjljZi00N2YzLTljZjUtMTExOGZiNDhlZjVmXkEyXkFqcGdeQVRoaXJkUGFydHlJbmdlc3Rpb25Xb3JrZmxvdw@@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNjY3NTAxZjUtNjljZi00N2YzLTljZjUtMTExOGZiNDhlZjVmXkEyXkFqcGdeQVRoaXJkUGFydHlJbmdlc3Rpb25Xb3JrZmxvdw@@._V1_.jpg","description":"Official Trailer"},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0005240/","name":"Moby"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000186/","name":"David Lynch"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0591777/","name":"Julie Mintz"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm3964003/","name":"Rob Gordon Bralver"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0744176/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm3964003/","name":"Rob Gordon Bralver"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0005240/","name":"Moby"}],"duration":"PT1H32M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.title: Poranek kojota

programme.title: One Fine Day
Szczęśliwy dzień
One Fine Day
programme.desc:
One Fine Day: Directed by Michael Hoffman. With Michelle Pfeiffer, George Clooney, Mae Whitman, Alex D. Linz. The lives of two strangers and their young children unexpectedly intersect on one hectic, stressful day in New York City." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0117247/","name":"One Fine Day","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNDdhMjgxODQtZjNhNS00YjZiLWFmYTAtODZmM2RhM2M3YmIwXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMTQxNzMzNDI@._V1_.jpg","description":"The lives of two strangers and their young children unexpectedly intersect on one hectic, stressful day in New York City.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0117247/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"philipdavies"},"dateCreated":"2003-08-21","inLanguage":"English","name":"Just occasionally, Hollywood still lets us have a grown-up entertainment ...","reviewBody":"The headlong screwball comedy of this breakneck romance of two stressed-out single parents is a delight from beginning to end. It has scenes as quick witted - and often as wackily off-kilter! - as the adults must be just in order to survive their average day. Stir love into this mess of two increasingly desparate modern lives and you get a miraculous souffle of a film, at once sharp and sweet.

No scene is laboured, no point is telegraphed, and - phenomenally for a modern American film - neither kids nor kittens are allowed to smother the audience in the nauseous layers of cutesiness that are usually applied. The scene with the analyst, where Clooney must obscure his account of his sex-life in an ever-more-surrealistic periphrasis involving iced cakes and fish, since his little daughter has to accompany him into the presumably crecheless analyst's surgery, and her dad is embarassed to expose her to such adult matters as he is obliged to reveal during the session, is a scene which is a model of intelligent and stylish comedy writing. The dialogue of both himself and his analyst finally founders on the increasingly strained comparisons and metaphors being attempted. The analyst begins to construct an alarmingly kinky lifestyle for his client out of what he takes to be Freudian suggestions - but which are, as noted, merely the product of old-fashioned seemliness - whereupon Clooney is forced to bring the whole towering edifice back down to earth when his version of the morning's business with the goldfish gets mixed up in the heady brew of symbolism: 'No. I mean fish. You know - 'Fish' fish?'

The humour is all good, never strained, and beautifully played by all the principals, including the wonderfully un-sentimentalised children. The transformation, stage-by-stage, of the harsh mutual competition and resentment that exists at first between these harassed adults, into an exhausted truce, by way of barely-restrained irritation, grudging gratitude, reluctant respect, and growing affection, is handled with considerable dramatic finesse throughout.

To produce the unlikely union of such an ill-assorted pair under such utterly unpropitious and unromantic circumstances is a comedic challenge of considerable proportions, and the makers of this film do an excellent job to bring it off at all. The spirits of Grant and Hepburn - even Beatrice and Benedict - are not too far away.

The only disappointment is to see how many people in the audience have gone home just as sour as when they arrived, judging from some of the comments here. But then, love curdles in any mean-spirited breast.

 One particularly admires the fact that, at its conclusion, the film's romantic clincher - when the tired-out couple have to settle for just falling asleep together, despite their by now clearly desparate need for each other, - insists upon the importance of exactly this: Love, rather than merely lust, as the basis for an adult relationship.

Just occasionally, Hollywood still lets us have a grown-up entertainment. It makes a pleasant and wholesome change from the usual fare of adolescent dreams."},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":45255,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.5},"contentRating":"PG","genre":["Comedy","Drama","Romance"],"datePublished":"1996-12-20","keywords":"architect,united states,usa,mother son relationship,friendship","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"One Fine Day","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi3298689305","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMjJjMTlhOGYtZGM4MC00MjFiLTliMjEtYWI0NDdhNmQzNmIwXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMjJjMTlhOGYtZGM4MC00MjFiLTliMjEtYWI0NDdhNmQzNmIwXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg","description":"Home Video Trailer from 20th Century Fox Home Entertainment"},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000201/","name":"Michelle Pfeiffer"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000123/","name":"George Clooney"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0926165/","name":"Mae Whitman"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001355/","name":"Michael Hoffman"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0017497/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0002149/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0195234/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0783559/","name":"Terrel Seltzer"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0800124/","name":"Ellen Simon"}],"duration":"PT1H48M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.title: Chocolate Road

Chocolate Road
programme.desc: Chocolate Road: Directed by Tanya Chuturkova. With Frances Louise Bekele, Joe Cullen Brown, Martin Christy, Elvin Ovidio Ávila Flores. Three renowned chocolatiers - Maribel Lieberman, Susumu Koyama and Mikkel Friis-Holm - take us through the process of craft chocolate-making all the way from the tree to the final chocolate piece. On their journey, each of them finds how important it is to know the roots of their primer material - the cacao bean, and how they can highly impact the lives of the people involved in the chocolate production chain." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt9866220/","name":"Chocolate Road","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BZmExMzg3NmMtMzM0ZC00M2E0LWJkMzMtNjUyZjk1NTAwZWFlXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMjEzNjUxNTM@._V1_.jpg","description":"Three renowned chocolatiers - Maribel Lieberman, Susumu Koyama and Mikkel Friis-Holm - take us through the process of craft chocolate-making all the way from the tree to the final chocolate piece. programme.title: Kiler
Kiler
programme.desc: Kiler: Directed by Juliusz Machulski. With Cezary Pazura, Malgorzata Kozuchowska, Jerzy Stuhr, Janusz Rewinski. An innocent cab driver Jurek Kiler is mistaken for a contract killer and imprisoned. Soon, he is sprung by a mob boss who needs "Killer" for a few more jobs." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0127626/","name":"Kiler","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMDRkNWMxYWEtODUwMC00ZDRjLWI0MmQtMjFjNTFiMDYwZDZiXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNjExODE1MDc@._V1_.jpg","description":"An innocent cab driver Jurek Kiler is mistaken for a contract killer and imprisoned. Soon, he is sprung by a mob boss who needs "Killer" for a few more jobs.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0127626/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"cjpok"},"dateCreated":"1999-06-28","inLanguage":"English","name":"Lots of action with funny twists","reviewBody":"This could easily be called the Polish version of "Pulp Fiction" but thank God, it is not. It is captivating from the very get-go, keeping the viewing audience as hostage to the very end. Although unique in style and approach, it is universal and could appeal to any audience, anywhere in the world. Humorous and tastefully prepared.No wonder Hollywood already bought rights to the story. We may see it on this side of the pond. I hope without Bruce Willis or other Hollywood screen "heroes". programme.title: The Pianist
Pianista
The Pianist
programme.desc:
The Pianist: Directed by Roman Polanski. With Adrien Brody, Emilia Fox, Michal Zebrowski, Ed Stoppard. A Polish Jewish musician struggles to survive the destruction of the Warsaw ghetto of World War II." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0253474/","name":"The Pianist","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BOWRiZDIxZjktMTA1NC00MDQ2LWEzMjUtMTliZmY3NjQ3ODJiXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNjU0OTQ0OTY@._V1_.jpg","description":"A Polish Jewish musician struggles to survive the destruction of the Warsaw ghetto of World War II.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0253474/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"ashcoounter"},"dateCreated":"2003-02-01","inLanguage":"English","name":"Brilliantly Narrated, Visually Stunning!","reviewBody":"Polanski has depicted the gory details of the holocaust without much restraint. But, the most wonderful aspect of the film is that the director has not lost focus of his story and instead of focusing too much on the holocaust horror he has weaved the true-life narrative of survival around devillish happenings.

Every single act of escapade Szpilman goes through is depicted like a drop of water on a barren desert. However, the Oasis in the driest desert comes in the end and it is here that Polanski captures the essence of human emotion. I had this very strong urge of jumping into the theater screen and magically adopting a character in the movie and doing something about the helplesness portrayed so convincingly.

Overall, Polanski has given a stunning visual narrative of the cold war. Survival indeed is a privilege though it is taken for granted today. Performances by Brody, Kretschmann deserve applause.

Pawel Edelman's camera work is moving and he has brilliantly captured the dark sadness in the visual canvas in an effective way. The lighting is amazing. Pre-dawn shooting schedule could have helped a great deal.

Hervé de Luze's editing work has ensured that the narrative does not slip away from focus. Most notable is the scene where the human bodies are lit on fire and the camera raises to show the smoke. The darkness of the smoke is enhanced and is used effectively to fade the scene out.

The scene where Brody's fingers move as he rests his hands on the bars of the tram handle only goes to show the brilliance of Polanski as a film-maker.

Great film that will be in the running for this year's Oscars. I will give it a 9 Out of 10.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":9}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":777302,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":8.5},"contentRating":"(Banned)","genre":["Biography","Drama","Music"],"datePublished":"2002-09-25","keywords":"pianist,holocaust,survival,nazi occupied poland,person in a wheelchair falls from height","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"The Pianist","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi988938521","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMmQ4MWQzNDEtYmI4Zi00NmY0LWEwYTEtZTg4MmQ3MDM2YmJlXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMmQ4MWQzNDEtYmI4Zi00NmY0LWEwYTEtZTg4MmQ3MDM2YmJlXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg","description":"Theatrical Trailer from Focus Features"},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0004778/","name":"Adrien Brody"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0470981/","name":"Thomas Kretschmann"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0277975/","name":"Frank Finlay"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000591/","name":"Roman Polanski"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0024473/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0030304/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0053177/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0367838/","name":"Ronald Harwood"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0844262/","name":"Wladyslaw Szpilman"}],"duration":"PT2H30M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.title: Polanski, Horowitz. The Wizards from the Ghetto
Polański, Horowitz. Hometown
programme.desc: Polanski, Horowitz. The Wizards from the Ghetto: Directed by Mateusz Kudla, Anna Kokoszka-Romer. With Roman Polanski, Ryszard Horowitz, Bronislawa Horowitz Karakulska, Stanislaw Buchala. Roman Polanski and Ryszard Horowitz came to Poland to share with us the most personal memories from their childhood and youth." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt8546414/","name":"Polanski, Horowitz. The Wizards from the Ghetto","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMjg0NmQ3NmEtY2NkOC00ZmI2LTg3YmUtNTc2MGEwNWQ2OWFiXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNjk5MjEzMTY@._V1_.jpg","description":"Roman Polanski and Ryszard Horowitz came to Poland to share with us the most personal memories from their childhood and youth.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt8546414/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"belenus-133-722656"},"dateCreated":"2021-10-31","inLanguage":"English","name":"Very moving true strory.","reviewBody":"This is a beautiful documentary. It takes you right into the heart of the darkest period in the 20th century, right into the heart of a Holocaust - Krakow in Poland, where the famous Plaszow ghetto was located and where the trains were loaded for Auschwitz. It's also a very intimate and moving portrait of a true friendship between two great artists. We get to see incredible suffering but also have a chance to witness a fantastic sense of humour, which obviously is the best way to deal with such sad memories. We can also now understand why Polanski refused to film "The Shindler's List" and instead filmed "The Pianist". We should be very grateful to film authors. PS - People who give this film a low rating obviously have not seen it.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":10}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":31,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":5.8},"genre":["Documentary"],"datePublished":"2021-08-20","keywords":"childhood","actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000591/","name":"Roman Polanski"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1058543/","name":"Ryszard Horowitz"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm7061785/","name":"Bronislawa Horowitz Karakulska"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm8896961/","name":"Mateusz Kudla"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm9896989/","name":"Anna Kokoszka-Romer"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0701909/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm9896989/","name":"Anna Kokoszka-Romer"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm8896961/","name":"Mateusz Kudla"}],"duration":"PT1H15M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.title: Seasoned with Love
Przyprawione miłością
Seasoned with Love
programme.desc:
Seasoned with Love: Directed by Claude Desrosiers. With Julia Benson, Peter Benson, Tori Barban, Kolton Stewart. Winona Applegate is on the fast track to becoming a celebrity chef, already running a very successful bistro in Pittsburgh. With nerves building, she leaves for New York to audition for her own show in front of television executives. Unfortunately, her car breaks down near New Holland, a small, quirky town where Winona rents a room at a local inn run by Adam, a widower. With the local Spring Festival coming up and the resident cook unavailable to manage the menu, Winona agrees to get her car fixed in time for her audition in exchange for her much needed help in the Inn's kitchen. As she prepares for the festival with Adam, Winona begins to fall in love with New Holland and one of its residents as well." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt13013696/","name":"Seasoned with Love","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNzcyOWRiZGQtMzk2Ni00ODRjLWJiZTAtOGQxZGNhNTU4NDJlXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMTk1NzUwMA@@._V1_.jpg","description":"Winona Applegate is on the fast track to becoming a celebrity chef, already running a very successful bistro in Pittsburgh. With nerves building, she leaves for New York to audition for her own show in front of television executives.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt13013696/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"peterkoch-98114"},"dateCreated":"2021-08-21","inLanguage":"English","name":"The ingredients of an enjoyable movie","reviewBody":"For a memorable feast you need a selection of fresh ingredients, a simple to follow recipe and a pot of imagination and good fortune. This film has those items sprinkled throughout. For men like me it's reassuring to have an average looking man win the heart of a gorgeously vivacious woman, even after finding out in real life they've been married more than 10 years. And also for married men it's encouraging to see that a woman is willing to fall in love with that man again after that much time has passed. I became so involved with the passage of this romance I fretted over the director dropping the ball in the final minutes, only to be surprised by one of the most convincing and satisfying endings I've seen.

Those actors that supported the main story also supplied a warmth that left an after taste that was richly enjoyable. My mother told me to never criticise other peoples' cooking, but I so enjoyed the film that those little thoughts didn't come to anything. It's not a complicated story, but importantly it's an interesting story, like a favourite meal I can see myself sitting down to enjoy again and again.

I've done a small number of reviews for films that surprised and unexpectedly delighted me, such that I hope you may feel the same. A realistic 7.5 score feels understated but heartfelt.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":8}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":153,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.6},"genre":["Comedy","Romance"],"datePublished":"2021-04-30","actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1365460/","name":"Julia Benson"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1193045/","name":"Peter Benson"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm3379570/","name":"Tori Barban"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1068982/","name":"Claude Desrosiers"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0099956/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0228741/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm5949587/","name":"Gemma Holdway"}],"duration":"PT1H30M"}</script><metacontent="

Winona Applegate is on the fast track to becoming a celebrity chef, already running a very successful bistro in Pittsburgh. With nerves building, she leaves for New York to audition for her own show in front of television executives. Unfortunately, her car breaks down near New Holland, a small, quirky town where Winona rents a room at a local inn run by Adam, a widower. With the local Spring Festival coming up and the resident cook unavailable to manage the menu, Winona agrees to get her car fixed in time for her audition in exchange for her much needed help in the Inn's kitchen. The Racer: Directed by Kieron J. Walsh. With Louis Talpe, Matteo Simoni, Tara Lee, Iain Glen. It follows a rider who, after being dropped from the team, is reinstated following a doping error." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt8374436/","name":"The Racer","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMjZiNDIzYTktMTY5OC00MzU5LWE2NDItYTg2YWY4ZDMzNDFmXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMDM2NDM2MQ@@._V1_.jpg","description":"It follows a rider who, after being dropped from the team, is reinstated following a doping error.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt8374436/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"portrushme"},"dateCreated":"2021-04-01","inLanguage":"English","name":"Just appallingly woeful","reviewBody":"Thought I would give this a watch but it is truly awful. If you think this is what the Tour de France looks like and how a professional cyclist would conduct himself, then you will be having the wool pulled over your eyes.

The action scenes are truly laughable and I am sure of more than one occasion, the director of the film had the Irish flag the wrong way round. What cyclist goes to the pub on the evening of the race start lol

Even though stand the cheat that is Lance Armstrong,The Program is a far superior cycling film.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":1}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":1272,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":5.9},"genre":["Drama","Sport"],"datePublished":"2020-09-09","keywords":"road cycling,professional athlete,cyclist,bicycle racing team,cycling accident","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Official Trailer","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi2260517145","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BN2ZlMTU0OTQtYmJhYi00MTUxLWJjOTctZTU3YzMyY2Q1Yzg0XkEyXkFqcGdeQXRyYW5zY29kZS13b3JrZmxvdw@@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BN2ZlMTU0OTQtYmJhYi00MTUxLWJjOTctZTU3YzMyY2Q1Yzg0XkEyXkFqcGdeQXRyYW5zY29kZS13b3JrZmxvdw@@._V1_.jpg","description":"Seasoned 'Super-domestique', Dom Chabol, experiences the most dramatic three days of his life as he faces the end of his time with his team, the end of his career, and even the end of his life, at the opening Irish stages of the notorious 1998 Tour de France, known as the 'Tour Du Dopage'. programme.title: Voir le jour
Na świat
Voir le jour
programme.desc: Voir le jour: Directed by Marion Laine. With Sandrine Bonnaire, Brigitte Roüan, Aure Atika, Sarah Stern. Jeanne works in a maternity yard in Marseille. Day and night, she struggles with her colleagues to support the mothers and their babies." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt11154574/","name":"Voir le jour","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNjBkMDgzNWUtZmFjMy00MTY2LTljMGEtNjkyMzc3ZjAxMjhkXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMTAwMzM3NDI3._V1_.jpg","description":"Jeanne works in a maternity yard in Marseille. Day and night, she struggles with her colleagues to support the mothers and their babies.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt11154574/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"ulicknormanowen"},"dateCreated":"2021-03-31","inLanguage":"English","name":"A nurse's work is never done.","reviewBody":"It could not have come at a better time,this tribute to the staff of a maternity hospital:midwives, nurses, nurses' aides .I could do without Bonnaire's rock singer past and her daughter's clichéed frames of mind ;the gist of the movie , which takes place in the maternity is close to documentary ,and Sandrine Bonnaire is not really the star , all the actresses are admirable: the midwife (Brigitte Rouan ) did not choose this job -she wanted to become a doctor- but her work has become her raison d'être ,in spite of moments of despondency .These underpaid women 's commitment to their work is extraordinary: from the nurses' aide who rocks a crying baby to sleep to Bonnaire who literally saves a baby -and there's won't be any vainglory or legion d'honneur -;one feels the compassion ,the camaraderie ,the solidarity when one of them is held responsible for the death of a baby ,the joie de vivre when ,during a rebellion against the inhuman working conditions (a meager bonus of 20 euros for night work ) , they break into a song "mamy blue" which cheers them up. Even though sometimes they quarrel or meet people at the door shouting against the termination of pregnancy.\n\nThe first sequence sums it up in an admirably succint style: too many patients , shortstaffed nurses and others...","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":7}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":112,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":5.8},"genre":["Drama"],"datePublished":"2020-08-12","keywords":"mother,midwife,maternity","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Bande-annonce [OV]","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi845725209","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BODg1YTZlZmYtY2ZiYy00ZWFlLThmNTItOWIwZTc5NzVlYWY4XkEyXkFqcGdeQXRyYW5zY29kZS13b3JrZmxvdw@@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BODg1YTZlZmYtY2ZiYy00ZWFlLThmNTItOWIwZTc5NzVlYWY4XkEyXkFqcGdeQXRyYW5zY29kZS13b3JrZmxvdw@@._V1_.jpg","description":""},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0094789/","name":"Sandrine Bonnaire"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0747690/","name":"Brigitte Roüan"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0004133/","name":"Aure Atika"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0481866/","name":"Marion Laine"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0486596/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0028557/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0624903/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1125358/","name":"Julie Bonnie"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0481866/","name":"Marion Laine"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm8279997/","name":"Laura Piani"}],"duration":"PT1H31M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.title: A Beautiful Mind
Piękny umysł
A Beautiful Mind
programme.desc:
A Beautiful Mind: Directed by Ron Howard. With Russell Crowe, Ed Harris, Jennifer Connelly, Christopher Plummer. After John Nash, a brilliant but asocial mathematician, accepts secret work in cryptography, his life takes a turn for the nightmarish." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0268978/","name":"A Beautiful Mind","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMzcwYWFkYzktZjAzNC00OGY1LWI4YTgtNzc5MzVjMDVmNjY0XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMTQxNzMzNDI@._V1_.jpg","description":"After John Nash, a brilliant but asocial mathematician, accepts secret work in cryptography, his life takes a turn for the nightmarish.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0268978/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"ccthemovieman-1"},"dateCreated":"2006-02-01","inLanguage":"English","name":"Crowe Does It Again!","reviewBody":"The more I watch Russell Crowe, the more I am becoming a big fan of his acting talent. Here again, he demonstrates his skills in a role that had me spellbound. Of course, mentally-ill people are usually fascinating. Look how popular the cable television show "Monk" has become.

Crowe's character, mathematician John Nash, is not nearly as eccentric as "Monk," but his schizophrenia makes for a fascinating portrait of a very troubled man. This is another of those Ron Howard based-on-a-true-story films, so don't take everything here as gospel truth....because it ain't so. (One example: in real life, Nash's wife was anything but as supportive as Jennifer Connelly was portrayed here.)

The first time I saw this film I was disappointed. Maybe I expected more, maybe I felt the story was unfair to the viewer and I felt like this was just one more attempt at Liberal Hollywood to make fun of those in the 1950s who were opposed to Communism. Well, on the second viewing, just a few weeks ago, I didn't have a problem with any of those things, just enjoying the performances and the classy-looking cinematography, thanks to one of the best cameramen in the business, Roger Deakins. I'm not always a fan of director Ron Howard, but his films are usually interesting and pleasing to the eye. He and Crowe seem to be a good pair, too, as witnessed by 2005's "Cinderella Man."

For those who enjoy a cerebral thriller, this is a very intriguing film. Ed Harris, Paul Bettany, Adam Goldberg, Judd Hirsch, Josh Lucas and Anthony Rapp all deliver solid supporting help and, if you haven't seen this, this story will deliver a big surprise. If you know the ending, a second viewing is even more interesting as you trace Nash's actions from the beginning.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":9}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":887814,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":8.2},"contentRating":"PG-13","genre":["Biography","Drama"],"datePublished":"2002-03-06","keywords":"mathematician,schizophrenia,mental illness,nobel prize,game theory","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Official Trailer","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi1801239321","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BOTNkYzBiMTgtOTRkOS00ZTAyLTkyZjItMWY0YjE5MjJhYzRiXkEyXkFqcGdeQXRodW1ibmFpbC1pbml0aWFsaXplcg@@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BOTNkYzBiMTgtOTRkOS00ZTAyLTkyZjItMWY0YjE5MjJhYzRiXkEyXkFqcGdeQXRodW1ibmFpbC1pbml0aWFsaXplcg@@._V1_.jpg","description":""},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000128/","name":"Russell Crowe"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000438/","name":"Ed Harris"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000124/","name":"Jennifer Connelly"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000165/","name":"Ron Howard"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0005073/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0819670/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0003687/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0326040/","name":"Akiva Goldsman"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0621586/","name":"Sylvia Nasar"}],"duration":"PT2H15M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.title: La Gomera
Oszustki
The Hustle
programme.desc:
La Gomera: Directed by Corneliu Porumboiu. With Vlad Ivanov, Catrinel Marlon, Rodica Lazar, Sabin Tambrea. Not everything is as it seems for Cristi, a policeman who plays both sides of the law. Embarking with the beautiful Gilda on a high-stakes heist, both will have to navigate the twists and turns of corruption, treachery and deception." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt7921248/","name":"La Gomera","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMjI4MjM1NTctMmQwYy00ZDE3LTllOTAtODRlNjJkMTg1MDAwXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMDA4NzMyOA@@._V1_.jpg","description":"Not everything is as it seems for Cristi, a policeman who plays both sides of the law. Embarking with the beautiful Gilda on a high-stakes heist, both will have to navigate the twists and turns of corruption, treachery and deception.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt7921248/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"mjfhhh"},"dateCreated":"2019-08-08","inLanguage":"English","name":"a rewarding experience for those who will stick with it until the end","reviewBody":"Cristi is a middle aged undercover police officer with mommy issues who is trying to find the location of some stolen money. So he goes to a remote island to learn a whistling language that will allow him to communicate with the criminals from a distance. There he rekindles a relationship with his old flame and his priorities change. As both the criminals and his colleagues are onto Cristi what choices will he make to come out clean of his predicament? A clever game of cops and robbers ensues.

Summing up this multi layered, not always coherent plot, is not an easy task. THE WHISTLERS takes a long time to get going but it's many elements come together building up to something special. Heavy on movie references it is heavily inspired by Tarantino movies, although the style of the cinematography is rather dull.

The script on paper must look great, but this is the case where a writer should let go of his work and let someone else direct. Cornelliu Porumboiu helmed 13 films but seems to be still searching for his directing style. While all the cast do their job well, the motives of their characters for the majority of the film are obscure to say the least.

But if this is the originality you are looking for THE WHISTLERS is for you. IMDb data; ttnr: 7921248, Title: La Gomera, --- Description: La Gomera: Directed by Corneliu Porumboiu. With Vlad Ivanov, Catrinel Marlon, Rodica Lazar, Sabin Tambrea. Not everything is as it seems for Cristi, a policeman who plays both sides of the law. Embarking with the beautiful Gilda on a high-stakes heist, both will have to navigate the twists and turns of corruption, treachery and deception." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt7921248/","name":"La Gomera","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMjI4MjM1NTctMmQwYy00ZDE3LTllOTAtODRlNjJkMTg1MDAwXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMDA4NzMyOA@@._V1_.jpg","description":"Not everything is as it seems for Cristi, a policeman who plays both sides of the law. Embarking with the beautiful Gilda on a high-stakes heist, both will have to navigate the twists and turns of corruption, treachery and deception.","review":"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt7921248/","author":"@type":"Person","name":"mjfhhh","dateCreated":"2019-08-08","inLanguage":"English","name":"a rewarding experience for those who will stick with it until the end","reviewBody":"Cristi is a middle aged undercover police officer with mommy issues who is trying to find the location of some stolen money. So he goes to a remote island to learn a whistling language that will allow him to communicate with the criminals from a distance. There he rekindles a relationship with his old flame and his priorities change. As both the criminals and his colleagues are onto Cristi what choices will he make to come out clean of his predicament? A clever game of cops and robbers ensues.

Summing up this multi layered, not always coherent plot, is not an easy task. THE WHISTLERS takes a long time to get going but it's many elements come together building up to something special. Heavy on movie references it is heavily inspired by Tarantino movies, although the style of the cinematography is rather dull.

The script on paper must look great, but this is the case where a writer should let go of his work and let someone else direct. Cornelliu Porumboiu helmed 13 films but seems to be still searching for his directing style. While all the cast do their job well, the motives of their characters for the majority of the film are obscure to say the least.

But if this is the originality you are looking for THE WHISTLERS is for you. With good timing and a genuine sense of wit it is a rewarding experience for those who will stick with it until the end.","reviewRating":"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":6,"aggregateRating":"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":5114,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.3,"contentRating":"Not Rated","genre":["Comedy","Crime","Drama"],"datePublished":"2019-09-13","keywords":"female rear nudity,canary islands,police detective,policeman,police officer","trailer":"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Official Trailer","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi1044168473","thumbnail":"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BOGIyOWU0MWYtY2IzZS00ZWMwLThkMDgtYWU5MDA2MjVmMWEwXkEyXkFqcGdeQXRyYW5zY29kZS13b3JrZmxvdw@@._V1_.jpg","thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BOGIyOWU0MWYtY2IzZS00ZWMwLThkMDgtYWU5MDA2MjVmMWEwXkEyXkFqcGdeQXRyYW5zY29kZS13b3JrZmxvdw@@._V1_.jpg","description":"","actor":["@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0412096/","name":"Vlad Ivanov","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm5054840/","name":"Catrinel Marlon","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1120715/","name":"Rodica Lazar"],"director":["@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1717949/","name":"Corneliu Porumboiu"],"creator":["@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0180401/","@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0167020/","@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0245364/","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1717949/","name":"Corneliu Porumboiu"],"duration":"PT1H37M"</script><metacontent=" --- Director: Corneliu Porumboiu

The Good Liar
programme.desc: Die Goldfische: Directed by Alireza Golafshan. With Tom Schilling, Klaas Heufer-Umlauf, Lisa Bitter, Sabrina Dietel. A good natured comedy about tax evasion and disability." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt7689310/","name":"Die Goldfische","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BOTg2YTMyYjMtMTQ3Mi00OTU4LTlmMDEtYzQ2YjVjNWYxZDA1XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMDU5MDEyMA@@._V1_.jpg","description":"A good natured comedy about tax evasion and disability.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt7689310/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"kosmasp"},"dateCreated":"2021-05-12","inLanguage":"English","name":"Pricey fish","reviewBody":"Certain things may be hard for us as viewers to connect to. Not being a banker or someone who is detached from human interaction in general, it is not easy to fully identify with the main character here. And there are flaws or at least weird decisions along the way ... but it is a comedy and it tries to be as funny as it can be overall.\n\nThat out of the way, I had no idea what the movie would be like or any story element, so color me shocked and surprised by the inciting incident at the start of the movie. I did not see that coming/happening. After that "bang" the movie takes a minute to breathe a little bit and that is the moment you see the human in our main character. Overall we get quite a few of cliches though, but still it does its best to stay on the right side of funny and delicate when it touches certain subjects. Funny but predictable - still entertaining if you let it.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":7}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":1680,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.6},"genre":["Comedy"],"datePublished":"2019-03-21","keywords":"disability,wilhelm scream","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Die Goldfische","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi3829447705","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNDZiZjViMDctZWE0Mi00NDdlLThjYzQtN2Q3YWQ0NjEyMmE0XkEyXkFqcGdeQTNwaW5nZXN0._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNDZiZjViMDctZWE0Mi00NDdlLThjYzQtN2Q3YWQ0NjEyMmE0XkEyXkFqcGdeQTNwaW5nZXN0._V1_.jpg","description":"Official Trailer"},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0771713/","name":"Tom Schilling"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1678891/","name":"Klaas Heufer-Umlauf"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm3474804/","name":"Lisa Bitter"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm2285783/","name":"Alireza Golafshan"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0027692/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0239725/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0008261/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm2285783/","name":"Alireza Golafshan"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1487045/","name":"Justyna Müsch"}],"duration":"PT1H51M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.title: Cheung gong 7 hou
CJ7
Cheung gong 7 hou
programme.desc:
Cheung gong 7 hou: Directed by Stephen Chow. With Stephen Chow, Jiao Xu, Lei Huang, Yuqi Zhang. A poor Chinese laborer learns important lessons after his son gets a strange new toy." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0940709/","name":"Cheung gong 7 hou","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTUxNTQxNTY5OF5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTcwNjEyNjg1MQ@@._V1_.jpg","description":"A poor Chinese laborer learns important lessons after his son gets a strange new toy.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0940709/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"jdesando"},"dateCreated":"2008-04-18","inLanguage":"English","name":"Out There","reviewBody":""It can be demonstrated that the child's contact with the real world is strengthened by his periodic excursions into fantasy. It becomes easier to tolerate the frustrations of the real world and to accede to the demands of reality if one can restore himself at intervals in a world where the deepest wishes can achieve imaginary gratification." Selma H. Fraiberg, Child Psychologist 

Stephen Chow is a big star in Asia, and his fantasy CJ7 is a big hit. Although I'm not sure American audiences will return a Jackie-Chan-like box office bundle for this E. T. knock off, I do know that allegorical, off-the-wall, science fictional kid flicks like this are rare and fun if you give yourself into their absurdity.

Some critics liken Chow to Jerry Lewis; Chow is much more imaginative than Lewis, relying as Chow does less on slapstick and more on the intriguing impulses of a small Chinese boy, whose poverty serves as a catalyst for his life-defining experience discovering an outer space dog-like companion and his own love for a hapless but adorable father. Overcoming the bullying about his status in the playground and finding love in a classmate, teacher, father, and alien are enough for most of us in a lifetime.

Chow handles the eccentric material with ease as he minimizes CGI and marginalizes himself for the impressive talents of young Jiao Xu (actually a girl) as the growing-up-fast Dickey. The film comes close to Lassie-like sentiment but never fully settles in that territory. The requisite moralizing, in this case about the importance of love and education, is not suffocating, and the imaginative dream sequences are just that: out-there fantasies of a boy who needs a faithful toy and loving father.

The Yangtze River is known as "Changjiang" in Mandarin, therefore the shortened "CJ," which is also the name for Chinese activities such as space probes. No matter, for these multiple references serve to emphasize the lighter than air world of a man, his boy, and a space dog.

E. T. has come home again in a different form with much less fanfare, yet every child has to love the anarchy."},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":15365,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.4},"contentRating":"PG","genre":["Animation","Adventure","Comedy"],"datePublished":"2008-01-30","keywords":"father son relationship,bullying,lollipop,china,cockroach","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"U.S. trailer: CJ7","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi1991377177","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTQ1NzE5ODg5NF5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwNjkwMjczMzE@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTQ1NzE5ODg5NF5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwNjkwMjczMzE@._V1_.jpg","description":"This is the U.S. theatrical trailer for CJ7, directed by Stephen Chow."},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0159507/","name":"Stephen Chow"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm2514879/","name":"Yuqi Zhang"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm2922341/","name":"Jiao Xu"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0159507/","name":"Stephen Chow"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0041248/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0020819/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0049799/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0159507/","name":"Stephen Chow"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0463674/","name":"Vincent Kok"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0874683/","name":"Kan-Cheung Tsang"}],"duration":"PT1H28M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.desc: Driveways: Directed by Andrew Ahn. With Lucas Jaye, Hong Chau, Brian Dennehy, Laurent Rejto. A lonesome boy accompanies his mother on a trip to clean out his late aunt's house, and ends up forming an unexpected friendship with the retiree who lives next door." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt9318280/","name":"Driveways","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BY2E4MGRmZDQtMTUxYy00OWE2LWE4ZGUtMGI0ZjI4MGUxMjM1XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMjA2OTE4OA@@._V1_.jpg","description":"A lonesome boy accompanies his mother on a trip to clean out his late aunt's house, and ends up forming an unexpected friendship with the retiree who lives next door.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt9318280/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"Megan_Shida"},"dateCreated":"2020-06-04","inLanguage":"English","name":"Succinct and Compelling","reviewBody":"Roughly an hour and twenty minutes, this movie does not waste effort or time. It is a compelling story of friendship, life choices, and aging, all accomplished in a neat and tidy little package. The acting from your three leads is terrific and the directing is on point, as the film engages the viewer in three stories about life at three distinct ages, and the opportunities that emerge for empathy and friendship between them. I recommend this film, as well as Spa Night by the same director.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":8}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":5623,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":7.3},"genre":["Drama"],"datePublished":"2020-05-07","keywords":"friendship,dome magnifier,8 year old,8 year old boy,old man young boy relationship","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Official Trailer","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi825803033","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BZDgzYzNjODAtMjQ2NC00ZTgwLWE2NmItNjEyNTdmZThkYTM1XkEyXkFqcGdeQXRyYW5zY29kZS13b3JrZmxvdw@@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BZDgzYzNjODAtMjQ2NC00ZTgwLWE2NmItNjEyNTdmZThkYTM1XkEyXkFqcGdeQXRyYW5zY29kZS13b3JrZmxvdw@@._V1_.jpg","description":"A lonesome boy accompanies his mother on a trip to clean out his late aunt's house, and ends up forming an unexpected friendship with the retiree who lives next door."},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm5102227/","name":"Lucas Jaye"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm2186865/","name":"Hong Chau"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001133/","name":"Brian Dennehy"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm3821224/","name":"Andrew Ahn"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0135778/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0464499/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0729964/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm2314136/","name":"Hannah Bos"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm3227768/","name":"Paul Thureen"}],"duration":"PT1H23M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.title: Intolerable Cruelty
Okrucieństwo nie do przyjęcia
Intolerable Cruelty
programme.desc: Intolerable Cruelty: Directed by Joel Coen, Ethan Coen. With George Clooney, Catherine Zeta-Jones, Geoffrey Rush, Cedric the Entertainer. A beautiful gold digger matches wits with a shrewd Beverly Hills divorce lawyer who is increasingly attracted to her." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0138524/","name":"Intolerable Cruelty","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTU2OTc5Mjc0N15BMl5BanBnXkFtZTYwMDYyMjg3._V1_.jpg","description":"A beautiful gold digger matches wits with a shrewd Beverly Hills divorce lawyer who is increasingly attracted to her.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0138524/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"warnerclassic"},"dateCreated":"2004-10-29","inLanguage":"English","name":"Not intolerable, but","reviewBody":"George Clooney stars as a self-loving whiter than white toothed lawyer who is becoming bored with his never-ending success. A challenge comes in the shapely form of Marilyn Rexroth (Catherine Zeta Jones) who wants to marry (or preferably divorce) her way to riches. With Clooney hired to represent her soon to be ex husband, he inevitably falls for the gold diggers charms.\n\nDirected by the Coen brothers, a directorial team who have helmed oddball comedies such as 'Fargo' and 'O Brother, Where Art Thou?' this is the team's first branch in to a high profile Hollywood film. Clooney, as the sharp suited lawyer, is excellent. Like Cary Grant or David Niven, Clooney is able to mock himself without compensating his screen appeal. Catherine Zeta Jones as the money hungry Marilyn is as sexy as her character demands from the scripted page. However, despite the quick fire dialogue, Intolerable Cruelty is simply not as funny as it thinks, it's cynical message of love and money taking away the romantic push it needs to place it in the league of the Tracy/Hepburn films the movie aspires to. Clooney's character also suffers from an over enthusiastic plot that later drives his character to attempt to commit a crime that totally contradicts the audiences perception of him. A battle of the sexes comedy that has sex appeal but no romance, Intolerable Cruelty is a film that reaches for the golden age of Hollywood but only touches the bronze."},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":95179,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.2},"contentRating":"PG-13","genre":["Comedy","Crime","Romance"],"datePublished":"2003-12-24","keywords":"woman wears eyeglasses,strong female character,lake tahoe,reference to henry viii,deception","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Intolerable Cruelty","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi781320473","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BZmYzNTk4NGUtZDQ5My00MDEzLTlkZGMtNDU3MzE3MDQ0ZmI2XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BZmYzNTk4NGUtZDQ5My00MDEzLTlkZGMtNDU3MzE3MDQ0ZmI2XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg","description":"Home Video Trailer from Universal Pictures"},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000123/","name":"George Clooney"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001876/","name":"Catherine Zeta-Jones"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000671/","name":"Billy Bob Thornton"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001054/","name":"Joel Coen"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001053/","name":"Ethan Coen"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0005073/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0003687/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0049706/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0709070/","name":"Robert Ramsey"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0832043/","name":"Matthew Stone"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0738908/","name":"John Romano"}],"duration":"PT1H40M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.title: Ex Machina
Ex Machina
programme.desc:
Ex Machina: Directed by Alex Garland. With Domhnall Gleeson, Alicia Vikander, Oscar Isaac, Sonoya Mizuno. A young programmer is selected to participate in a ground-breaking experiment in synthetic intelligence by evaluating the human qualities of a highly advanced humanoid A.I." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0470752/","name":"Ex Machina","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTUxNzc0OTIxMV5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwNDI3NzU2NDE@._V1_.jpg","description":"A young programmer is selected to participate in a ground-breaking experiment in synthetic intelligence by evaluating the human qualities of a highly advanced humanoid A.I.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0470752/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"Michael_Elliott"},"dateCreated":"2015-09-25","inLanguage":"English","name":"A Different Sort of Picture","reviewBody":"Ex Machina (2015) 

*** 1/2 (out of 4) 

A different sort of science fiction film, a programmer (Domhnall Gleeson) wins what is basically a lottery to go and spend a week with his company's owner (Oscar Isaac). The owner, Nathan, pretty much created a search engine but he's gone a step further by creating an artificial intelligent woman named Ava (Alicia Vikander) who the programmer is supposed to examine and question.

EX MACHINA pretty much came out of nowhere and became a good hit across the world and I'm rather shocked that it did. Usually dumb science fiction movies with a lot of mindless actions are the ones that make money and not those that features very little to no action and instead just dialogue and thought. What really sets this film apart is the fact that it asks more questions than anything else and it expects the viewer to think about those questions and the impact that certain actions could have.

The visual style of the film is quite impressive and it's certainly a very interesting film to just look at. The music score is quite haunting and perfectly captures the mood of the film. There's the terrific cinematography that pulls you into the setting. The special effects are also extremely impressive. I loved the set and the look of this compound but the special effects are the real star. If you didn't believe that you were really looking at and operating with real artificial intelligent creatures then the entire film just wouldn't have the same feeling.

Then there are the performances, which are a major plus. Gleeson pretty much plays the role that is typically a nerd but the film never lowers the character to that simple term and instead makes him a very interesting person. Even the role of the billionaire played by Isaac isn't what you'd typically see and the actor brings a certainly coldness to the part. Vikander is flawless and steals the picture in her role.

EX MACHINA certainly won't be a movie for everyone but it's good to think about the questions that it asks."},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":507744,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":7.7},"contentRating":"R","genre":["Drama","Sci-Fi","Thriller"],"datePublished":"2015-01-21","keywords":"artificial intelligence,turing test,minimal cast,robot,robot human relationship","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"New Trailer","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi744337689","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTUyMjQzNzk0MF5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwNTE4NjM0NTE@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTUyMjQzNzk0MF5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwNTE4NjM0NTE@._V1_.jpg","description":"A young programmer is selected to participate in a breakthrough experiment in artificial intelligence by evaluating the human qualities of a breathtaking female A.I.
"},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm2539953/","name":"Alicia Vikander"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1727304/","name":"Domhnall Gleeson"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1209966/","name":"Oscar Isaac"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0307497/","name":"Alex Garland"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0390816/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0005073/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0197272/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0307497/","name":"Alex Garland"}],"duration":"PT1H48M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.title: La Gomera
Oszustki
The Hustle
programme.desc:
La Gomera: Directed by Corneliu Porumboiu. With Vlad Ivanov, Catrinel Marlon, Rodica Lazar, Sabin Tambrea. Not everything is as it seems for Cristi, a policeman who plays both sides of the law. Embarking with the beautiful Gilda on a high-stakes heist, both will have to navigate the twists and turns of corruption, treachery and deception." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt7921248/","name":"La Gomera","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMjI4MjM1NTctMmQwYy00ZDE3LTllOTAtODRlNjJkMTg1MDAwXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMDA4NzMyOA@@._V1_.jpg","description":"Not everything is as it seems for Cristi, a policeman who plays both sides of the law. Embarking with the beautiful Gilda on a high-stakes heist, both will have to navigate the twists and turns of corruption, treachery and deception.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt7921248/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"mjfhhh"},"dateCreated":"2019-08-08","inLanguage":"English","name":"a rewarding experience for those who will stick with it until the end","reviewBody":"Cristi is a middle aged undercover police officer with mommy issues who is trying to find the location of some stolen money. So he goes to a remote island to learn a whistling language that will allow him to communicate with the criminals from a distance. There he rekindles a relationship with his old flame and his priorities change. As both the criminals and his colleagues are onto Cristi what choices will he make to come out clean of his predicament? A clever game of cops and robbers ensues.

Summing up this multi layered, not always coherent plot, is not an easy task. THE WHISTLERS takes a long time to get going but it's many elements come together building up to something special. Heavy on movie references it is heavily inspired by Tarantino movies, although the style of the cinematography is rather dull.

The script on paper must look great, but this is the case where a writer should let go of his work and let someone else direct. Cornelliu Porumboiu helmed 13 films but seems to be still searching for his directing style. While all the cast do their job well, the motives of their characters for the majority of the film are obscure to say the least.

But if this is the originality you are looking for THE WHISTLERS is for you. With good timing and a genuine sense of wit it is a rewarding experience for those who will stick with it until the end.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":6}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":5114,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.3},"contentRating":"Not Rated","genre":["Comedy","Crime","Drama"],"datePublished":"2019-09-13","keywords":"female rear nudity,canary islands,police detective,policeman,police officer","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Official Trailer","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi1044168473","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BOGIyOWU0MWYtY2IzZS00ZWMwLThkMDgtYWU5MDA2MjVmMWEwXkEyXkFqcGdeQXRyYW5zY29kZS13b3JrZmxvdw@@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BOGIyOWU0MWYtY2IzZS00ZWMwLThkMDgtYWU5MDA2MjVmMWEwXkEyXkFqcGdeQXRyYW5zY29kZS13b3JrZmxvdw@@._V1_.jpg","description":""},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0412096/","name":"Vlad Ivanov"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm5054840/","name":"Catrinel Marlon"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1120715/","name":"Rodica Lazar"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1717949/","name":"Corneliu Porumboiu"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0180401/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0167020/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0245364/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1717949/","name":"Corneliu Porumboiu"}],"duration":"PT1H37M"}</script><metacontent="

Jesus and Maria José are siblings living in the house of their father, recently deceased. This routine is interrupted by the arrival of Magdalena, their paternal half-sister. After many years without being with her brothers, she comes from Spain to claim her share of the house inherited from their father. However, the brothers, who do not want to sell it, start playing wicked games with her, in which it is difficult to distinguish who has the stone, who has the paper and who has the scissors (jankenpon)." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt8474184/","name":"Piedra, papel y tijera","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BYjU2NmQyNmYtMzg5YS00Y2I0LTkzYTEtOGE2N2YyYTcxNGEyXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMjc5MzMyNQ@@._V1_.jpg","description":"Jesus and Maria José are siblings living in the house of their father, recently deceased. programme.title: Family Romance, LLC
Spółka rodzinna
Family Romance, LLC
programme.desc:
Family Romance, LLC: Directed by Werner Herzog. With Ishii Yuichi, Mahiro Tanimoto, Miki Fujimaki, Takashi Nakatani. A man is hired to impersonate the missing father of a young girl." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt10208194/","name":"Family Romance, LLC","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BYWZhYjc1NjAtNzgzYy00OGQzLWI5ZDAtMWU2ZjI3OTljZTY3XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyODY0MDM5Njk@._V1_.jpg","description":"A man is hired to impersonate the missing father of a young girl.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt10208194/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"philip-davies31"},"dateCreated":"2020-07-03","inLanguage":"English","name":"Japan's culture is still very strange to us.","reviewBody":"Surely that utterly dishonest Japanese substitution and impersonation of real persons in real situations is just weird, and wrong? Confusing psychodrama and reality as if there is no difference says something disturbing about the Japanese sense of self. Any Westerner would find such a practice a disturbing and offensive intrusion into and offensive parody of their personal integrity.

In the West we can accept role-playing dramas, which often have satisfying or even cathartic effects, because the illusion is a temporary imaginary leap, and the experience an exercise in self-analysis and mindfulness. Lessons are drawn which can be applied back in one's real life, having been a recreation that strengthens our emotional life, just as physical exercise strengthens our body. Well-written dramas can also impart this kind of creative refreshment. But the Japanese acceptance of play-acting as essentially indistinguishable from actuality, and as having the identical moral standing of authentic behaviour, is surely a dangerous category confusion? This seems to be exposed as the film shows the difficulty the man finds in posing convincingly as the father of a young child while at the same time keeping his emotional distance - as it is stipulated he must as a condition of his employment. One thinks in the West of those unpleasant consequences where undercover security operations have led to the betrayal of the emotions and the lives of partners whom agents have fallen in love with, even married and had children by, in the guise of an entirely false persona. Court cases have tended to follow.

One can speculate that this disturbing insincerity, which can so easily turn into real but still cheating feelings, is only tolerable in a society and culture that within living memory was still highly formalised according to strict traditional imperatives, that dictated not only the physical but also, to an extreme degree, the interior life of the people. This deprived thought and action of any moral component, producing a culture - as is well known - of shame, instead of guilt; of dissimulation, not confession.

A society that recently valued only mere correct appearance remains vulnerable to such imposture, treating what we would deem impostors and deceivers exactly like authentic persons. If the Japanese still lack, to some degree, the moral centre to distinguish between mere artifice and psychological integrity, then their obsession with automata as acceptable simulacra of human beings, even without application of any Turing test to demonstrate actual sentience, is indicative.

I don't say the Japanese have no modern sensibility, of course. After the terrible debacle, in the Second World War, of their unique traditional world-view, they have finally entered the moral universe. However, it seems they do retain a residual psychological tendency that remains susceptible to mere appearances. This has led them seriously astray (I suggest) in the current practice, as it is shown by this interesting Herzog film, 'Family Romance.'","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":6}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":2313,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.7},"contentRating":"Not Rated","genre":["Drama"],"datePublished":"2020-07-03","keywords":"father,rent,japan,cherry blossom,taking a photograph","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Official Trailer","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi1826995225","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNmVkYjI1NzQtY2ZlOC00NzQyLWJjN2ItYmEzZDIxNWFiMWNlXkEyXkFqcGdeQXRyYW5zY29kZS13b3JrZmxvdw@@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNmVkYjI1NzQtY2ZlOC00NzQyLWJjN2ItYmEzZDIxNWFiMWNlXkEyXkFqcGdeQXRyYW5zY29kZS13b3JrZmxvdw@@._V1_.jpg","description":"A man is hired to impersonate the missing father of a 12 year old girl."},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm10348089/","name":"Ishii Yuichi"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm10640857/","name":"Mahiro Tanimoto"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm11334855/","name":"Miki Fujimaki"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001348/","name":"Werner Herzog"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0361457/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001348/","name":"Werner Herzog"}],"duration":"PT1H29M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.title: Cheung gong 7 hou
CJ7
Cheung gong 7 hou
programme.desc:
Cheung gong 7 hou: Directed by Stephen Chow. With Stephen Chow, Jiao Xu, Lei Huang, Yuqi Zhang. A poor Chinese laborer learns important lessons after his son gets a strange new toy." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0940709/","name":"Cheung gong 7 hou","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTUxNTQxNTY5OF5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTcwNjEyNjg1MQ@@._V1_.jpg","description":"A poor Chinese laborer learns important lessons after his son gets a strange new toy.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0940709/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"jdesando"},"dateCreated":"2008-04-18","inLanguage":"English","name":"Out There","reviewBody":""It can be demonstrated that the child's contact with the real world is strengthened by his periodic excursions into fantasy. It becomes easier to tolerate the frustrations of the real world and to accede to the demands of reality if one can restore himself at intervals in a world where the deepest wishes can achieve imaginary gratification." Selma H. Fraiberg, Child Psychologist 

Stephen Chow is a big star in Asia, and his fantasy CJ7 is a big hit. Although I'm not sure American audiences will return a Jackie-Chan-like box office bundle for this E. T. knock off, I do know that allegorical, off-the-wall, science fictional kid flicks like this are rare and fun if you give yourself into their absurdity.

Some critics liken Chow to Jerry Lewis; Chow is much more imaginative than Lewis, relying as Chow does less on slapstick and more on the intriguing impulses of a small Chinese boy, whose poverty serves as a catalyst for his life-defining experience discovering an outer space dog-like companion and his own love for a hapless but adorable father. Overcoming the bullying about his status in the playground and finding love in a classmate, teacher, father, and alien are enough for most of us in a lifetime.

Chow handles the eccentric material with ease as he minimizes CGI and marginalizes himself for the impressive talents of young Jiao Xu (actually a girl) as the growing-up-fast Dickey. The film comes close to Lassie-like sentiment but never fully settles in that territory. The requisite moralizing, in this case about the importance of love and education, is not suffocating, and the imaginative dream sequences are just that: out-there fantasies of a boy who needs a faithful toy and loving father.

The Yangtze River is known as "Changjiang" in Mandarin, therefore the shortened "CJ," which is also the name for Chinese activities such as space probes. No matter, for these multiple references serve to emphasize the lighter than air world of a man, his boy, and a space dog.

E. T. has come home again in a different form with much less fanfare, yet every child has to love the anarchy."},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":15365,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.4},"contentRating":"PG","genre":["Animation","Adventure","Comedy"],"datePublished":"2008-01-30","keywords":"father son relationship,bullying,lollipop,china,cockroach","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"U.S. trailer: CJ7","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi1991377177","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTQ1NzE5ODg5NF5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwNjkwMjczMzE@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTQ1NzE5ODg5NF5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwNjkwMjczMzE@._V1_.jpg","description":"This is the U.S. theatrical trailer for CJ7, directed by Stephen Chow."},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0159507/","name":"Stephen Chow"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm2514879/","name":"Yuqi Zhang"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm2922341/","name":"Jiao Xu"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0159507/","name":"Stephen Chow"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0041248/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0020819/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0049799/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0159507/","name":"Stephen Chow"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0463674/","name":"Vincent Kok"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0874683/","name":"Kan-Cheung Tsang"}],"duration":"PT1H28M"}</script><metacontent="

T. has come home again in a different form with much less fanfare, yet every child has to love the anarchy.","aggregateRating":"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":15365,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.4,"contentRating":"PG","genre":["Animation","Adventure","Comedy"],"datePublished":"2008-01-30","keywords":"father son relationship,bullying,lollipop,china,cockroach","trailer":"@type":"VideoObject","name":"U.S. trailer: CJ7","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi1991377177","thumbnail":"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTQ1NzE5ODg5NF5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwNjkwMjczMzE@._V1_.jpg","thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTQ1NzE5ODg5NF5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwNjkwMjczMzE@._V1_.jpg","description":"This is the U.S. theatrical trailer for CJ7, directed by Stephen Chow.","actor":["@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0159507/","name":"Stephen Chow","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm2514879/","name":"Yuqi Zhang","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm2922341/","name":"Jiao Xu"],"director":["@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0159507/","name":"Stephen Chow"],"creator":["@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0041248/","@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0020819/","@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0049799/","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0159507/","name":"Stephen Chow","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0463674/","name":"Vincent Kok","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0874683/","name":"Kan-Cheung Tsang"],"duration":"PT1H28M"</script><metacontent=" --- Director: Stephen Chow

programme.title: The SpongeBob Movie: Sponge Out of Water
Spongebob: Na suchym lądzie
The SpongeBob Movie: Sponge Out of Water
programme.desc:
The SpongeBob Movie: Sponge Out of Water: Directed by Paul Tibbitt, Mike Mitchell. With Antonio Banderas, Eric Bauza, Tim Conway, Eddie Deezen. When a diabolical pirate above the sea steals the secret Krabby Patty formula, SpongeBob and his nemesis Plankton must team up in order to get it back." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt2279373/","name":"The SpongeBob Movie: Sponge Out of Water","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMjYyNDczNTE0MF5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwNjkzNDYxMzE@._V1_.jpg","description":"When a diabolical pirate above the sea steals the secret Krabby Patty formula, SpongeBob and his nemesis Plankton must team up in order to get it back.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt2279373/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"Drive-in_Zeppelin"},"dateCreated":"2015-02-08","inLanguage":"English","name":"Nautical Nonsense takes on a whole new dimension (literally)","reviewBody":"Seriously though, unless you have been living under a rock like Patrick the starfish for the last few decades, you should at least have formed an opinion about the Spongebob series. It has a talking sponge that lives in a pineapple, flips burgers, and goes on nonsensical adventures with his slow-witted friend and neighbor. You either find it whimsical and funny or you don't. 

This holds true for the second feature film Sponge Out of Water as we find our beloved residents of Bikini Bottom forced to enter our three dimensional world for the first time. After a flamboyant pirate (Antonio Banderas) manages to steal the much sought after secret Krabby Patty recipe using a magic book, Spongebob and co. have their world plunged into anarchy with the sudden loss of the greasy burgers.

As expected (if you watched the show as a kid), our heroes have to go on a series of misadventures to recover the secret recipe and stop the mischievous pirate after he commits industrial theft. 

The thing your probably not expecting (if you've seen the trailer), is only a very small portion of this short film is actually 3D. It's not glaringly awful, and actually seems to work fairly well in a movie about abstract craziness that features time-traveling dolphins.

It's fun, plain and simple. The children in the audience we're giggling with delight, the adults found humor enough to laugh, and all in all I appreciated the blatant references to movies like Mad Max, Hitchhiker's Guide to the Galaxy, and The Shining. It's a movie that is directed at children, but is enriched with plenty of adult humor in the form of puns and famous movies references. 

Just enjoy it for what it is and you won't be disappointed. The animation is surreal and enjoyable as always, the voice-acting is tried and true, and everyone in the theater seemed to enjoy it thoroughly. 

Mild drug use is recommended for optimal viewing and humor extraction. 

Read the full review and others like it on the Drive-In Zeppelin website.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":6}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":52775,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6},"contentRating":"PG","genre":["Animation","Adventure","Comedy"],"datePublished":"2015-01-30","keywords":"dinosaur,formula,plankton,secret formula,bubble","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Trailer #1","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi421768985","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BOTY1NDEwNTY2MF5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwODMwNjYxMzE@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BOTY1NDEwNTY2MF5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwODMwNjYxMzE@._V1_.jpg","description":"After spending his entire life under the sea in the Bikini Bottom Gulch, Spongebob, Patrick and the rest of their friends go on a quest to find the stolen recipe for their Krabby Patty burgers, which brings them into our world, where they encounter a nefarious pirate named Burger-Beard.
"},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0444786/","name":"Tom Kenny"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000104/","name":"Antonio Banderas"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0265067/","name":"Bill Fagerbakke"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1196684/","name":"Paul Tibbitt"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0593610/","name":"Mike Mitchell"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0390995/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0004265/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0020957/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0008743/","name":"Jonathan Aibel"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0074184/","name":"Glenn Berger"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0384864/","name":"Stephen Hillenburg"}],"duration":"PT1H32M"}</script><metacontent="
